org.ensor.math.geometry

Interface IPath<VectorType>

  • Type Parameters:
    VectorType - The type of position value returned by the path.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NaturalSpline2D, NaturalSpline3D, NaturalSpline4D

    public interface IPath<VectorType>
    This interface models a smooth path function which is capable of returning a vector position for any arbitrary point in time "t" along the path.
    Author:
    jona

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VectorType getDirection(double aTime)
      Returns the tangent to the curve for the given point in time.
      double getLength()
      Returns the overall length of the path.
      VectorType getPosition(double aTime)
      Returns the position along the path for the given point in time.

    • Method Detail

      • getPosition

        VectorType getPosition(double aTime)
        Returns the position along the path for the given point in time.
        Parameters:
        aTime - Point in time from 0 (beginning of path) to 1 (end of path).
        Returns:
        The 3d position associated with this point in time.

      • getDirection

        VectorType getDirection(double aTime)
        Returns the tangent to the curve for the given point in time.
        Parameters:
        aTime - Point in time from 0 (beginning of path) to 1 (end of path).
        Returns:
        The 3d tangent vector (normalized to 1) associated with this point in time.

      • getLength

        double getLength()
        Returns the overall length of the path. Note that this is the actual length traveled, not the 'as the crow flies' distance between start and end. Also note that for simple paths such as linear interpolation, this is fairly exact, however, for more complicated curves like cubic splines, this is an estimate since making a closed-form expression for these curves is extremely difficult.
        Returns:
        The path length traveled from start to end.
